primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The liberation of the entire 'bent' creation from the bondage of sin and decay by the Creator.

tekstueel_bewijs: by the will of him who subjected it in hope
it will not be by an act of man, but by an act of God
his creator would not, finally, let him go

object.identificatie: Redemption/Glorious liberty of the children of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the creation itself will be set free from its bondage to decay
obtain the glorious liberty of the children of God

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Word of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the Word of God read and interpreted
the whole creation has been groaning
not only the creation, but we ourselves
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as a co-receiver with nature, waiting in solidarity.

tekstueel_bewijs: remade... in the image of God’s own Son, Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_geest: External help/Indwelling power implied through 'remaking' the believer.

tekstueel_bewijs: the whole world is in the grip of sin
all hell shall endeavor to shake
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not just as a mistake but as a 'primeval dislocation' and a 'cosmic power' affecting insects, land mines, and the human heart.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church community enacting 'strategies of hope' (e.g., Fall Festival, volunteering) as a sign of the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Solidarity and 'cranking down the level of antipathy'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is a 'sign' or 'witness' to the primary work of God; it does not achieve the redemption but points to it.

voorbeelden_god_subject: His creator would not, finally, let him go.
I will not desert to his foes.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We wait for it with patience.
We come together on the Lord’s Day.
We are learning how to crank down the level of antipathy.

voorbeelden: The church is supposed to be...
I can will what is right, but I cannot do it.
Only as we hear the Word... do we come to understand.
The creation itself will be set free.
I will never, no never, no never forsake.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to save a Subject (Man/Creation) that is modally incompetent (cannot do the good it wants).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (the 'bent' nature/sin) through ~S1 (the failure of human will) to S1 (God's final act of not letting go).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's unilateral faithfulness ('I will never forsake').
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is treated as a structural and cosmic reality, not just a moral lapse.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of the redemption of both the individual and the cosmos. Human action is framed as a response/sign, not a condition.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Any thing that we can do... is a blow struck for the kingdom of God.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It will not be by an act of man, but by an act of God.
His creator would not, finally, let him go.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral templates; Paul is used as a witness to human inability.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who remakes us in the image of Christ.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and fortitude (patience) rather than performance anxiety.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is an objective reality being worked out by God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'cosmic' problem to the 'local' parish hall is well-integrated via the concept of 'signs'.
spanning_punten: The juxtaposition of the Cambodian killing fields with a parish Fall Festival creates a narrative tension regarding the 'scale' of hope.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The creation being set free from bondage; God not letting go despite 'all hell'.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (implied) remakes the believer into the image of the Son.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'primeval dislocation' that humans cannot fix.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: Strong theocentric structure where God is the Subject of the primary narrative program (Salvation) and humans are the Subject of the secondary program (Witness).

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon effectively uses human inability (lack of Pouvoir) to highlight God's sufficiency.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The 'heavy opponent' necessitates a Divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God saves) → Ethics (We act as signs).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the Gospel while addressing a specific, painful congregational context.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the 'Don Giovanni' anecdote, Greimasian analysis reveals that the anecdote functions to reinforce God as the 'Subject' who refuses to let the 'Object' (Man) go.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 8; this analysis shows how the sermon's 'engine' mirrors Paul’s own actantial structure of divine initiative.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Fall Festival' is not a moralistic requirement but a 'Secondary Program' subordinate to the 'Fundamental Program' of cosmic redemption.

appendices.notities: The sermon was preached in a context of congregational scandal, making the 'unconditional' nature of the actantial Subject (God) particularly relevant.
